message:
Thanks for the fast answer! 
So if we have a UI application that really heavily relies on IO (enormous tracing, logging and controlling of several external devices in parallel via TCP/IP, Serial etc. ) might this 'bit' of wasted threads lead to a slowed down UI because the UI thread may enter the CPU more infrequently because of the many many thread context switches? 
Moreover, can the worst usage of threads (including Thread.Sleep(1) in loops) influence other applications on the same machine?
